text: Peptide hormones are hormones whose molecules are peptide. Peptide hormones have shorter amino acid chain lengths than protein hormones. These hormones have an effect on the endocrine system of animals, including humans.K. Siddle, J. C. Hutton, Peptide Hormone Secretion/Peptide Hormone Action: A Practical Approach, Oxford University Press, 1991, . "The word peptide refers to peptide bonds between amino acids", according to media.https://biologydictionary.net/peptide-hormones/. Biologydictionary.net. Retrieved 2023-02-26 == List of peptide hormones in humans == * growth hormone * follicle-stimulating hormone (FSH) * insulin * leptin * luteinizing hormone (LH) * adrenocorticotropic hormone (ACTH) * adropin * amylin * angiotensin * atrial natriuretic peptide (ANP) * calcitonin * cholecystokinin (CCK) * gastrin * ghrelin * glucagon * melanocyte-stimulating hormone (MSH) * oxytocin * parathyroid hormone (PTH) * prolactin * renin * somatostatin * thyroid-stimulating hormone (TSH) * thyrotropin-releasing hormone (TRH) * vasopressin, also called arginine vasopressin (AVP) or anti-diuretic hormone (ADH) * vasoactive intestinal peptide (VIP) ==References== Category:Chemistry
title: Peptide hormone
